required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study Comparing Daclatasvir (BMS-790052) With Telaprevir Combined With Peginterferon Alfa-2a and Ribavirin in Patients With Chronic Hepatitis C Virus Infection
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 3 Evaluation of BMS-790052 (Daclatasvir) Compared With Telaprevir in Combination With Peginterferon Alfa-2a and Ribavirin in Treatment-Naive Patients With Chronic Hepatitis C

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to compare the effectiveness of BMS-790052 (Daclatasvir) and Telaprevir when given in combination with Peginterferon alfa-2a and Ribavirin in genotype 1b patients

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Genotype 1b Participants With Sustained Virologic Response at Follow-up Week 12 (SVR12)
primary_outcome.description: SVR12 was defined as hepatitis C virus RNA levels to be lower than the limit of quantitation, ie, 25 IU/mL target detected or target not detected at follow-up Week 12.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Genotype 1b Participants With Rapid Virologic Response (RVR) at Week 4
secondary_outcome.description: RVR was defined as hepatitis c virus RNA levels lower than lower limit of quantitation, ie, 25 IU/mL target not detected at Week 4 of treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Genotype 1b Participants With Extended Rapid Virologic Response (eRVR) at Both Week 4 and Week 12
secondary_outcome.description: eRVR was defined as hepatitis C virus RNA levels lower than the lower limit of quantitation, ie, 25 IU/mL target not detected at both Weeks 4 and 12 of treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Genotype 1b Participants With Complete Early Virologic Response (cEVR)
secondary_outcome.description: cEVR was defined as hepatitis C virus RNA levels lower than the lower limit of quantitation, ie, 25 IU/mL target not detected at Week 12 of treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Genotype 1b Participants With Sustained Virologic Response at Follow-up Week 24 (SVR24)
secondary_outcome.description: SVR24 was defined as hepatitis C virus RNA levels lower than the lower limit of quantitation, ie, 25 IU/mL target detected or target not detected at follow-up week 24 of treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Genotype 1a Participants With Sustained Virologic Response at Follow-up Week 12 (SVR12)
secondary_outcome.description: SVR12 was defined as hepatitis C virus RNA levels lower than the lower limit of quantitation, ie, 25 IU/mL target detected or target not detected at follow-up week 12 of treatment.

intervention.description: Film-coated tablet, oral, 60 mg, once daily, 24 weeks
Film-coated tablet, oral, 750 mg, 3 times daily
Solution for injection, subcutaneous injection, 180 μg, weekly
Film-coated tablet, oral, in a body weight stratified dose range of 1000-1200 mg per day

criteria.textblock:
Key Inclusion Criteria:
- Participants chronically infected with hepatitis C virus (HCV) genotype 1a or 1b
- HCV RNA viral load ≥10,000 IU/mL
- No prior treatment including but not limited to interferon, ribavirin, and direct-acting antivirals
- No history of cirrhosis liver biopsy within 3 years or Fibroscan® within 1 year
- Body mass index of 18 to 35 kg/m^2
- Negative for HIV and hepatitis B virus
Key Exclusion Criteria:
- Evidence of decompensated liver disease
- Evidence of medical condition other than HCV contributing to chronic liver disease

facility.name: University Of North Carolina At Chapel Hill School Of Med

link.description: For FDA Safety Alerts and Recalls refer to the following link: http://www.fda.gov/MEDWATCH/safety.htm

participant_flow.recruitment_details: A total of 793 participants were recruited at 90 sites in 15 countries.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Of the 793 participants, 605 were randomized to treatment. A total of 191 enrolled subjects did not enter the treatment period as they no longer met study entry criteria and a 602 participants were received treatment.

group.title: Daclatasvir + PEG-IFN Alpha-2a + Ribavirin
group.description: Participants received daclatasvir 60-mg tablet orally once daily for 24 weeks in combination with pegylated interferon alpha-2a (PEG-IFN alpha-2a)180 µg administered subcutaneously once a week for 24 or 48 weeks and ribavarin administered in a body weight stratified dose range of 1000–1200 mg per day (for participants weighing less than 75 kg, the total dose was 1000 mg per day and for those weighing greater than or equal to 75 kg, the dose was 1200 mg per day).

group.title: Telaprevir + PEG-IFN Alpha-2a + Ribavirin
group.description: Participants received 2 telaprevir 375-mg tablets orally 3 times a day for 12 weeks. PEG-IFN alpha-2a 180 µg was coadministered subcutaneously once a week for 24 or 48 weeks depending on response, and ribavirin in a body weight stratified dose range of 1000–1200 mg per day was administered twice daily with food.

drop_withdraw_reason.title: Participant does not meet study criteria

participants_list.participants: This total number includes 319 who completed treatment plus 65 who rejoined for follow-up.
This total number includes 160 who completed treatment plus 31 who rejoined for follow-up.

group.title: Daclatasvir + PEG-IFN Alpha-2a + Ribavirin
group.description: Participants received daclatasvir 60-mg tablet orally once daily for 24 weeks in combination with pegylated interferon alpha-2a (PEG-IFN alpha-2a)180 µg administered subcutaneously once a week for 24 or 48 weeks and ribavarin administered in a body weight stratified dose range of 1000–1200 mg per day (for participants weighing less than 75 kg, the total dose was 1000 mg per day and for those weighing greater than or equal to 75 kg, the dose was 1200 mg per day).

PEG-IFN alpha-2a 180 µg was coadministered subcutaneously once a week for 24 or 48 weeks depending on response, and ribavirin in a body weight stratified dose range of 1000–1200 mg per day was administered twice daily with food.

outcome.title: Percentage of Genotype 1b Participants With Sustained Virologic Response at Follow-up Week 12 (SVR12)
outcome.description: SVR12 was defined as hepatitis C virus RNA levels to be lower than the limit of quantitation, ie, 25 IU/mL target detected or target not detected at follow-up Week 12.
outcome.population: The analysis was performed in all treated participants who received at least 1 dose of active study therapy. Here, 'Number of participants analysed' signifies Genotype 1b participants assessed for SVR12 response.

group.title: Daclatasvir + PEG-IFN Alpha-2a + Ribavirin
group.description: Participants received daclatasvir 60-mg tablet orally once daily for 24 weeks in combination with pegylated interferon alpha-2a (PEG-IFN alpha-2a) 180 µg administered subcutaneously once a week for 24 or 48 weeks and ribavarin administered in a body weight stratified dose range of 1000–1200 mg per day (for participants weighing less than 75 kg, the total dose was 1000 mg per day and for those weighing greater than or equal to 75 kg, the dose was 1200 mg per day).

group.title: Telaprevir + PEG-IFN Alpha-2a + Ribavirin
group.description: Participants received 2 telaprevir 375-mg tablets orally 3 times a day for 12 weeks. PEG-IFN alpha-2a 180 µg was coadministered subcutaneously once a week for 24 or 48 weeks depending on response, and ribavirin in a body weight stratified dose range of 1000–1200 mg per day was administered twice daily with food.

measure.title: Percentage of Genotype 1b Participants With Sustained Virologic Response at Follow-up Week 12 (SVR12)
measure.description: SVR12 was defined as hepatitis C virus RNA levels to be lower than the limit of quantitation, ie, 25 IU/mL target detected or target not detected at follow-up Week 12.
measure.population: The analysis was performed in all treated participants who received at least 1 dose of active study therapy. Here, 'Number of participants analysed' signifies Genotype 1b participants assessed for SVR12 response.

analysis.groups_desc: Percentage difference between SVR12 rate in the experimental and control arms was computed using a stratum-adjusted Mantel-Haenszel confidence interval (95% level) for the difference in rates. The stratification factors were IL28B rs1297860 single nucleotide polymorphism (CC or non-CC) and baseline cirrhosis status (absent or present), unless otherwise indicated.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Test of noninferiority was based on noninferiority margin of -12% and 2-sided alpha level of 5%. That is, if the lower bound of the 95% CI > -12%, the Daclatasvir arm would be considered nonnferior to the telaprevir arm.

outcome.title: Percentage of Genotype 1b Participants With Rapid Virologic Response (RVR) at Week 4
outcome.description: RVR was defined as hepatitis c virus RNA levels lower than lower limit of quantitation, ie, 25 IU/mL target not detected at Week 4 of treatment.
outcome.population: The analysis was performed in all treated participants who received at least 1 dose of active study therapy. Here, 'Number of participants analysed' signifies Genotype 1b participants assessed for RVR response.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

event.sub_title: Drug reaction with eosinophilia and systemic symptoms

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Bristol-Myers Squibb Co. agreements with investigators vary; constant is our right to embargo communications regarding trial results prior to public release for a period ≤60 days from submittal for review. We will not prohibit investigators from publishing, but will prohibit the disclosure of previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results, and request postponement of single-center publications until after disclosure of the clinical trial's primary publication.
